Package edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.directory

Class FacultyDirectory

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.directory.FacultyDirectory
public class FacultyDirectory
extends java.lang.Object
FacultyDirectory contains all of the faculty object passed to it. Manages these with the ability to load faculty into the directory, or save the current directory to a file. Can also add faculty to the directory if the specified parameters are passed. Can return the directory as a 2D array, and also get faculty objects in the directory if their id is passed.
Author:
crjone24, eltreece

  • Constructor Details

    • FacultyDirectory

      public FacultyDirectory()
      Constructor for the FacultyDirectory class. Calls a different method in order to construct the linked list of faculty.

  • Method Details

    • newFacultyDirectory

      public void newFacultyDirectory()
      Resets the facultyDirectory to a new linked list

    • loadFacultyFromFile

      public void loadFacultyFromFile​(java.lang.String fileName)
      Loads the faculty from a file
      Parameters:
      fileName - file name
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file is not found

    • addFaculty

      public boolean addFaculty​(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, java.lang.String id, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String repeatPassword, int maxCourses)
      Constructs a faculty object from the given parameters. Then adds that faculty object to the faculty directory. Checks that there are no duplicates by iterating through the faculty directory and looking at the ids, if there is a duplicate id then the constructed faculty object is not added to the directory and false is returned. Returns true if the faculty object is successfully added to the directory.
      Parameters:
      firstName - first name
      lastName - last name
      id - id
      email - email
      password - password
      maxCourses - max courses
      repeatPassword - repeat password
      Returns:
      true if the faculty is successfully added to the faculty directory, false if there is a duplicate
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the password or repeatPassword are empty or null if faculty cannot be constructed from the given parameters

    • removeFaculty

      public boolean removeFaculty​(java.lang.String facultyId)
      Removed the faculty with the given id from the faculty directory. Done by iterating through the directory and checking if a faculty memeber has the same id as the parameter, if it does than the faculty object in the directory is removed at the current index, and true is returned. False is returned if the faculty directory is fully iterated through and there are no matches.
      Parameters:
      facultyId - faculty id
      Returns:
      true if the faculty is successfully removed, false if there is no match and nothing removed from the directory.

    • getFacultyDirectory

      public java.lang.String[][] getFacultyDirectory()
      Gets the faculty directory in the form of a 2D array. The array contains each faculty, and their first name, last name, and then id.
      Returns:
      2D array of the faculty directory

    • saveFacultyDirectory

      public void saveFacultyDirectory​(java.lang.String fileName)
      Saves the faculty directory to a file name.
      Parameters:
      fileName - file name
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the directory is unable to be written to file

    • getFacultyById

      public Faculty getFacultyById​(java.lang.String id)
      Gets the faculty by id. Done by iterating through the faculty directory and checking for the given id by each id at index. Returns the faculty object at index if their id matches with the given id. Returns null if there are no matches found. the ids match
      Parameters:
      id - id
      Returns:
      the faculty object with the given id if it exist in facultyDirectory, if it doesn't exist than null is returned.
